name: Remigijus Prialgauskis
shortBio: I create modern, attractive, and fast websites.

paragraphs.0: Hello! I am a third-year computer science student, learning to create attractive and fast web applications.
paragraphs.1: I have worked with many different technologies, but currently, I am focusing on full-stack development using Nuxt (an extension of the Vue framework).
paragraphs.2: I am always looking for opportunities to apply my skills to real-world problems and collaborate with like-minded developers.
paragraphs.3: During my studies, I gained additional experience by participating in Erasmus programs Blended Intensive Programs (BIPs) in Latvia and Germany.
paragraphs.4: I also recently completed a 3-month internship in Riga, Latvia, where I strengthened my practical skills in a professional environment.
paragraphs.5: When I'm not programming, I spend most of my free time watching various IT videos on my computer, watching anime, gradually learning Japanese, and playing computer games with friends.

builtWith: Built with Nuxt and Tailwind CSS, hosted on Vercel. All text set in

0.title: Computer Science Student
0.description: During my studies, I worked with many different technologies, from creating websites and mobile applications using Android Studio to game development using Godot Engine.
0.detailedDescription:
First Year:
I created two websites, one using HTML, CSS (Bootstrap), and JavaScript, and another using PHP and Tailwind CSS. I also collaborated with two classmates to create a 3D Tetris game using Unity.

Second Year:
I collaborated with two classmates to create a job posting website using the MERN technology stack. This project was written up as a scientific article and presented at the KVK technology conference. My second-year coursework included a project where I first used the Nuxt framework with Tailwind CSS and Node.js for the backend to create an achievement evaluation system web application. Another major project was a mobile application developed with Android Studio for a client in Vilnius. Working in a team of five students, we created an app to help users choose a smart home system. I was responsible for the Scrum master role, design, and frontend development.

Third Year:
Information is being updated.

1.title: 3-month Internship in Latvia
1.description: Together with two other students from KVK, I developed an LMS (Learning Management System) where different types of users could securely log in. I was responsible for team leadership, design, and frontend development.

2.title: 480-hour JavaScript Full-Stack Internship
2.description: During the internship, I experimented with new technologies, touched server-side programming for the first time, and used various frameworks and libraries.

0.title: LMS - Learning Management System
